Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with Eros riding on a goat on a panelled plinth, holding a shepherd's staff. The angular shoulder is decorated with tendrils in relief, interrupted by rectangular panel each side. At the rear is a ring handle. Within the base-ring is impressed a bound triple branch. The nozzle and handle are damaged.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2052)
